TextView.android:text: This list checklist is Quality assurance tool by the Council to improve, standardize and institutionalize the practice of Pharmacy
Name of Pharmacy
Contact Person (Admin)
Supervising Pharmacist
Registration Number
Date of support supervision
Types of drugs stocked
Regulatory Compliance
Is there a valid Certificate of Practice for the Pharmacist?
Does the Pharmacy have a valid license from NDA?
Are both documents prominently displayed on the Premises?
Are the Pharmacy auxiliary staff trained by PSU?
Is the code of ethics prominently displayed?
Total Score
Percentage Score
Is there evidence of the Pharmacist being Present at the stipulated times?
Are there records for attendance times for the technical staff?
Are written job descriptions/appointment letters available for all staff?
Do the staff in the Pharmacy have identification tags with their titles?
Does the Pharmacy have an organization structure with clear reporting mechanisms?
Total Score
Percentage Score
Does the size of the Pharmacy comply to NDA requirements
Does the Pharmacy have a sitting area for the Pharmacist
Are the premises regularly cleaned? Check the cleaning records
Are there demarcations for waiting , dispensing , stores and consultation area
Is there a designated area for storage of expired/rejected medicines
Does the premise have security and restricted access to controlled medicines
Are the floors, ceilings and walls free of cracks and leakages ?
Are the floors made of impervious materials e.g tiles,terrazo?
Is the storage area adequately labeled and dedicated for only medicines?
Does the Pharmacy have appropriate distribution vehicles/containers for medicines for delivery to drug outlets (if applicable)?
Total Score
Percentage Score
Storage and Procurement Practices
Are medicines stored as per their storage requirements?
Is there a temperature monitoring device for recording the temperatures within the pharmacy including the fridge? Are upto date records available
Are the medicines stored above the floor and below the ceiling?
Is there adequate ventilation for the storage area?
Are the storage areas cleaned frequently and records are maintained?
Are Procurements made from licensed facilities?
Are records of purchases maintained from the various suppliers?
Does the Pharmacist approve all purchases of medicines?
Does the Pharmacy have a list of suppliers and their contacts?
Are batch numbers and expiry dates captured in receipts for supply of medicines to clients?
Back up system for temperature maintenance during power failure available e.g ice packs
Total Score
Percentage Score
Does the Pharmacy have a Quality Policy?
Does each of the technical staff possess an upto date training file
Are the following Standard Operating Procedures(SOPs) available and followed
Storage of medicines?
Procurement of medicines?
Housekeeping and Personal hygiene?
Quality Inspection of medicines?
Quality assurance of Pharmaceutical services and products
Complaint handling system
Are upto date reference books available e.g BNF, UCG, Medical dictionary
Recall of supplied medicines
Cleaning procedure for vehicles/containers used in distribution including records (if applicable)?
Is there a procedure for repackaging of medicines/vaccines into appropriate containers e.g. light sensitive, closures, labeling?Is it followed?
Total Score
Percentage Score
Professional services
Are adverse events detected and reported?
Are product complaints detected, logged and reported?
Are the Pharmacy staff dressed in clean white coats or gowns?
Are the clients sensitized on drug residues and withdrawal periods before slaughter?
Is there a mechanism for tracking resistance of veterinary medicines
Is there any dilution of medicines done before supply? If yes, is there a procedure, is it followed and is it acceptable?
Are the clients sensitized on drug residues and withdrawal periods before slaughter?
Total Score
Percentage Score
Overall Total Score
Overall Percentage Score
Pharmacy Category
Additional Notes
